intro: Nierembergia hippomanica var. coerulea, commonly known as the blue-flowered bellflower, is a perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant color and delicate appearance.
